intro: Eremopoa altaica subsp. oxyglumis, commonly known as the Altai oxyglume eremopoa, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The species features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical significance lies in its adaptation to harsh climates and its role in local ecosystems.
